Narrativa gerada: StructureDefinition SubstanceDefinition-br

NomeBandeirasCard.TipoDescrição e condicionalismos
SubstanceDefinition C0..*SubstanceDefinitionThe detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing
Constraints: sub-br-001, sub-br-002, sub-br-003, sub-br-004
Fatias para identifier S1..*IdentifierIdentifier by which this substance is known
Fatia: Não ordenado, Aberto por value:system
identifier:unii S0..1IdentifierUNII (GSRS Global)
use 0..1codeusual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)
Padrão necessário: official
system 1..1uriThe namespace for the identifier value
Valor fixo: http://fdasis.nlm.nih.gov
value S1..1stringThe value that is unique
identifier:dcb S0..1IdentifierDenominação Comum Brasileira (DCB)
system 1..1uriThe namespace for the identifier value
Valor fixo: https://anvisa.gov.br/dcb
value S1..1stringThe value that is unique
identifier:cas S0..1IdentifierNúmero CAS
system 1..1uriThe namespace for the identifier value
Valor fixo: urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.61
value S1..1stringThe value that is unique
identifier:subid S0..1IdentifierSUB-ID (EMA)
system 1..1uriThe namespace for the identifier value
Valor fixo: http://ema.europa.eu/identifier
value S1..1stringThe value that is unique
identifier:anvisaCode S0..1IdentifierCódigo ANVISA da Substância
system 1..1uriThe namespace for the identifier value
Valor fixo: https://anvisa.gov.br/substancias/codigo
value S1..1stringThe value that is unique
status S1..1CodeableConceptStatus da substância (GSRS/ANVISA)
Vínculo: Status de Substância GSRS/Brasil (required)
classification S1..*CodeableConceptClassificação da substância (GSRS)
Vínculo: Classificação de Substância GSRS/Brasil (preferred)
domain S0..1CodeableConceptDomínio de uso
grade S0..*CodeableConceptGrau da substância
Vínculo: Grau de Substância - Brasil (preferred)
description S0..1markdownDescrição
manufacturer S0..*Reference(Organization)Fabricante/fornecedor
supplier S0..*Reference(Organization)Fornecedor
Fatias para property S0..*BackboneElementPropriedades (GSRS)
Fatia: Não ordenado, Aberto por value:type.text
property:solubility S0..*BackboneElementSolubilidade
type
text 1..1stringPlain text representation of the concept
Padrão necessário: Solubility
property:meltingPoint S0..1BackboneElementPonto de fusão
type
text 1..1stringPlain text representation of the concept
Padrão necessário: Melting Point
property:boilingPoint S0..1BackboneElementPonto de ebulição
type
text 1..1stringPlain text representation of the concept
Padrão necessário: Boiling Point
property:logP S0..1BackboneElementCoeficiente de partição
type
text 1..1stringPlain text representation of the concept
Padrão necessário: LogP
structure S0..1BackboneElementEstrutura molecular (GSRS)
molecularFormula S0..1stringFórmula molecular
molecularWeight S0..1BackboneElementPeso molecular
amount S1..1QuantityUsed to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements
value 1..1decimalNumerical value (with implicit precision)
unit 0..1stringUnit representation
Padrão necessário: g/mol
system 0..1uriSystem that defines coded unit form
Padrão necessário: http://unitsofmeasure.org
code 0..1codeCoded form of the unit
Padrão necessário: g/mol
representation S0..*BackboneElementRepresentação estrutural
type S0..1CodeableConceptThe kind of structural representation (e.g. full, partial)
representation S1..1stringThe structural representation as a text string in a standard format
code S0..*BackboneElementCódigos da substância
Fatias para name S1..*BackboneElementNome(s) da substância
Fatia: Não ordenado, Aberto por value:type
name:Todas as fatias Conteúdo/regras para todas as fatias
name S1..1stringThe actual name
type S1..1CodeableConceptName type e.g. 'systematic', 'scientific, 'brand'
Vínculo: Tipos de Nome de Substância - Brasil (required)
name:officialName S1..1BackboneElementNome oficial
type 1..1CodeableConceptName type e.g. 'systematic', 'scientific, 'brand'
Valor fixo: Como mostrado (Nome Oficial)
coding1..1CodingCode defined by a terminology system
Valor fixo: (complexo)
system1..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Valor fixo: http://farmaco.maxapex.net/brig/fhir/CodeSystem/substance-name-type-br
code1..1codeSymbol in syntax defined by the system
Valor fixo: official
name:commonName S0..*BackboneElementNome comum
type 1..1CodeableConceptName type e.g. 'systematic', 'scientific, 'brand'
Valor fixo: Como mostrado (Nome Comum)
coding1..1CodingCode defined by a terminology system
Valor fixo: (complexo)
system1..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Valor fixo: http://farmaco.maxapex.net/brig/fhir/CodeSystem/substance-name-type-br
code1..1codeSymbol in syntax defined by the system
Valor fixo: common
relationship S0..*BackboneElementRelações GSRS
substanceDefinition[x] S1..1Reference(SubstanceDefinition), CodeableConceptA pointer to another substance, as a resource or a representational code
type S1..1CodeableConceptFor example "salt to parent", "active moiety"
sourceMaterial S0..1BackboneElementMaterial de origem

Documentação para este formato

name: SubstanceDefinitionBR
title: Definição de Substância - Brasil
description: Profile brasileiro para SubstanceDefinition baseado no IDMP, adaptado para o contexto regulatório da ANVISA com suporte básico GSRS
purpose: Definir a estrutura padronizada para substâncias no contexto brasileiro, incluindo especificidades da ANVISA e compatibilidade básica GSRS para identificação, classificação e controle regulatório internacional
copyright: Copyright © 2025 Farmaco.io. Este trabalho está licenciado sob a MIT License.

element.short: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing
element.definition: The detailed description of a substance, typically at a level beyond what is used for prescribing.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().ofType(canonical) | %resource.descendants().ofType(uri) | %resource.descendants().ofType(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(ofType(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(ofType(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
Substâncias ativas devem ter UNII ou DCB ou código internacional (CAS)
constraint.expression: classification.where(coding.system = 'http://farmaco.maxapex.net/brig/fhir/CodeSystem/substance-classification-gsrs-br' and coding.code = 'active').exists() implies (identifier.where(system = 'http://fdasis.nlm.nih.gov').exists() or identifier.where(system = 'https://anvisa.gov.br/dcb').exists() or identifier.where(system = 'urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.61').exists())

constraint.human: Substâncias controladas devem ter extensão de categoria de controle
Pelo menos um identificador deve estar presente
Substâncias com UNII devem ter fórmula molecular quando aplicável

mapping.map: Substance (and derived classes: Chemical, Polymer, Protein, Nucleic_Acid, Structurally_Diverse)

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: Within the context of the FHIR RESTful interactions, the resource has an id except for cases like the create and conditional update. Otherwise, the use of the resouce id depends on the given use case.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of its narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies its meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: IETF language tag for a human language

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have a narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope. This is allowed to be a Parameters resource if and only if it is referenced by a resource that provides context/meaning.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags in their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R5/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

element.definition: The purpose of this identifier.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an identifier is permanent unless it explicitly says that it is temporary.

binding.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

element.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.
element.comment: This element deals only with general categories of identifiers.  It SHOULD not be used for codes that correspond 1..1 with the Identifier.system. Some identifiers may fall into multiple categories due to common usage.   Where the system is known, a type is unnecessary because the type is always part of the system definition. However systems often need to handle identifiers where the system is not known. There is not a 1:1 relationship between type and system, since many different systems have the same type.
element.requirements: Allows users to make use of identifiers when the identifier system is not known.

element.comment: Identifier.system is always case sensitive.
element.requirements: There are many sets  of identifiers.  To perform matching of two identifiers, we need to know what set we're dealing with. The system identifies a particular set of unique identifiers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.
element.comment: If the value is a full URI, then the system SHALL be urn:ietf:rfc:3986.  The value's primary purpose is computational mapping.  As a result, it may be normalized for comparison purposes (e.g. removing non-significant whitespace, dashes, etc.)  A value formatted for human display can be conveyed using the [http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/rendered-value](http://hl7.org/fhir/extensions/StructureDefinition-rendered-value.html)). Identifier.value is to be treated as case sensitive unless knowledge of the Identifier.system allows the processer to be confident that non-case-sensitive processing is safe.
